member.summary: Stretches pane to fill unused space.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.PaneStyles.PopUp
member.summary: Reverses border so that text pops out.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.PaneStyles.Command
member.summary: This pane is initially displayed as a borderless pane. When the user moves the mouse over the pane, the pane will do one of the following: 1.By default (or if the PaneStyles.Normal style is set for the pane), the pane will be drawn like the PaneStyles.Normal style pane above. 2.If the PaneStyles.PopUp style has been set for the pane, the pane will be drawn like thePaneStyles.PopUp style pane above.If the user right-clicks, left-clicks, or left-double-clicks on the pane, or moves the mouse away from the pane, the pane borders will no longer be displayed.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.PaneStyles.PopOut
member.summary: This pane is initially displayed as a borderless pane. When the user moves the mouse over the pane, the pane will be drawn like the PaneStyles.PopOut style pane above. If the user right-clicks, left-clicks, or left-double-clicks on the pane, or moves the mouse away from the pane, the pane borders will no longer be displayed.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.PaneStyles.NoBorders
member.summary: No 3-D border around the pane.

member.summary: Sends a string to the command line to be executed in the provided target document.
member.param: String to use as input.
Boolean indicating whether to activate the target document.
Boolean indicating whether to queue current active document to complete in the next OnIdle() when switching active documents.
Boolean indicating whether the sent string is echoed on the command line.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.Document.LockDocument
member.summary: This overload calls LockDocument(DocLockMode.Write, null, null,true).

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.Document.LockDocument(Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.DocumentLockMode,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Is used for locking documents in order to access their resources.
member.param: One of the locking modes from DocumentLockMode enum.

Command name. Each time a document is locked, it is considered the beginning of a "command", or action in Acad. This name is passed back by the doc manager reactor as the name of the command doing the locking. It can be null.
Name that is displayed on the command line if or when this command is undone. It can be null.

Prompt.If the document cannot be locked, due to a command already in progress in the target document, and if prompt is true, the standard prompt will be issued, and the user will be given an opportunity to complete the command in the target document and the lock will succeed. If the user chooses to cancel the lock request, or prompt is false, then the lock change will fail.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.DocumentLockMode
member.summary: Locking type Enum.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.DocumentLockMode.Read
member.summary: This locking type indicates a Read Only lock. It may coexist with Read locks placed by other execution contexts. It mutually excludes other Write and ExclusiveWrite locks. It allows the execution context to examine the given document contents, but not to modify.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.DocumentLockMode.Write
member.summary: This locking type indicates a Shared Write lock. It may coexist with Read locks placed by other execution contexts. It mutually excludes other Write and ExclusiveWrite locks. It allows the execution context to examine modify the given document contents.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.DocumentLockMode.None
member.summary: No locking.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.DocumentLockMode.ExclusiveWrite
member.summary: This locking type indicates an Exclusive Write lock. It mutually excludes all other lock types by other execution contexts. It allows the execution context to examine and modify the given document contents.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.DocumentLockMode.ProtectedAutoWrite
member.summary: This locking type is used instead of AutoWrite before executing code which might perform a nested document lock which should leave the AutoWrite lock intact. See the description following this table.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.DocumentLockMode.NotLocked
member.summary: This locking type indicates there is no locking on the document context.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ApplicationServices.DocumentLockMode.AutoWrite
member.summary: This locking type indicates an Automatic Write lock. The purpose of this lock mode is to group contiguous sequences of ActiveX requests that were made without explicit locking, together as a single command. This insures their behavior as a single command with regards to Undo and notification, rather than as a bunch of separate commands/operations. This lock mode has the same effect as Write, except it is only effective when no other lock is active. An automatic lock will be unlocked when any other kind of lock is requested, complete with notification and the end undo markers and will occur just before the new notification and start undo markers for the new lock request.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.EditorInput.Editor.TurnForcedPickOn

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.EditorInput.Editor.TurnForcedPickOff

member.summary: Formats a floating-point value as a string.
member.param: Value to format.
Units into which the string is formatted as a valid AutoCAD LUNITS value; if -1, uses the current value of LUNITS.
Number of decimal places of precision to include in the string; if -1, uses the current value of the AutoCAD LUPREC system variable.
member.returns: Resulting string.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.Converter.DistanceToString(System.Double)
member.summary: This method calls Converter.DistanceToString(Double value, DistanceUnitFormat units, Int32 precision) method using the current distance units format for units and the current value of the LUPREC system variable for precision.
member.param: Value to format.
member.returns: Resulting string.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.Converter.StringToDistance(System.String,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.DistanceUnitFormat)
member.summary: Converts a string that displays a real (double-precision floating-point) value expressed in the specified display format into a real value.
member.param: String to be converted.
Units in which the string is formatted; if -1, uses the current value of LUNITS.
member.returns: The result of the conversion.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.Converter.StringToDistance(System.String)
member.summary: This method calls Converter.StringToDistance(String value, DistanceUnitFormat units) method using the current DISTANCEunits format for units.
member.param: String to be converted.
member.returns: The result of the conversion.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.Converter.AngleToString(System.Double,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.AngularUnitFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Formats an angle into a string.
member.param: Angle to be converted.
Units into which the angle is formatted; if -1, uses the current value of AUNITS.
Number of decimal places of precision to include in the string; if -1 uses the current value of AUPREC.
member.returns: Result of the conversion,large enough to hold the formatted string (depends on requested mode and precision but 15 bytes is usually adequate).

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.Converter.AngleToString(System.Double)
member.summary: This method calls Converter.AngleToString(Double value, AngularUnitFormat units, Int32 precision) method using the current angular units format for units and the current value of the AUPREC system variable for precision.
member.param: Angle to be converted.
member.returns: Result of the conversion,large enough to hold the formatted string (depends on requested mode and precision but 15 bytes is usually adequate).

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.Converter.StringToAngle(System.String,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.AngularUnitFormat)
member.summary: Converts a string representation of an angle to a double-precision floating-point value.
member.param: String representation of the angle being converted.
Units in which the string is formatted; if -1, uses the current value of AUNITS.
member.returns: Result of the conversion, in radians.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.Converter.StringToAngle(System.String)
member.summary: This method calls Converter.StringToAngle(String value, AngularUnitFormat units) method using the current angular units format for units.
member.param: String representation of the angle being converted.
member.returns: Result of the conversion, in radians.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.DistanceUnitFormat

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags
member.summary: This members of this enumeration represent values that can be passed as the commandFlags argument.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.NoBlockEditor
member.summary: The command is blocked during a bedit session.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.NoUndoMarker
member.summary: The command and its undo markers will not be added to the undo file. This is intended for commands that don't modify the database, and therefore should not show up in the undo file.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.NoHistory
member.summary: The command will not be added to AutoCAD's repeat-last-command furnctionality.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.Interruptible
member.summary: The command may be interrupted when prompting for user input while it is calling any of the Getxxx methods.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.Session
member.summary: The command will be run in the application execution context rather than the current document context, with the different capabilities and limitations that entails. It should be used sparingly.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.DocExclusiveLock
member.summary: Document will be exclusively locked when command is invoked. If this bit is not set, then the document will be share locked when the command is invoked.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.DocReadLock
member.summary: Document will be read locked when command is invoked. If this bit is not set, then the document will be write locked when the command is invoked.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.Defun
member.summary: This flag can only be set by the Visual LISP engine. Command can be invoked as a LISP function and can therefore use acedGetArgs() to receive arguments from LISP and can use the methods to return values to LISP.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.Undefined
member.summary: Command can only be invoked via the cmdGroupName.cmdGlobalName syntax.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.NoPaperSpace
member.summary: Command cannot be invoked when in paperspace.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.NoTileMode
member.summary: Command cannot be invoked when TILEMODE == 1.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.NoPerspective
member.summary: Command cannot be invoked while the current viewport is in perspective mode.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.Redraw
member.summary: When the pickfirst set or grip set are retrieved, they are not cleared within AutoCAD.Command can retrieve the pickfirst set and the grip set by using the GetFirst method.Objects in these sets are redrawn with the proper grip handles and highlighting upon completion of the command.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.UsePickSet
member.summary: When the pickfirst set is retrieved, it is cleared within AutoCAD.Command is able to retrieve the pickfirst set via the method Getfirst().

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.Transparent
member.summary: Command can be invoked while another command is active.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.CommandFlags.Modal
member.summary: Command cannot be invoked while another command is active.

member.summary: This class implements a default plot progress dialog supplied as part of the ObjectARX SDK.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PlotProgressDialog.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Indicating whether to create a plot progress dialog for preview.
Number of sheets; creates a plot progress dialog to handle single-sheet plots by default.
Indicating whether the Cancel Sheet button is shown in the plot progress dialog (the default).

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PlotProgressDialog.IsSingleSheetPlot
member.summary: Gets true if the plot progress dialog was created to handle single-sheet plots and previews.

member.summary: Getsor sets the strings that appear in different UI controls of the plot progress dialog.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PlotProgressDialog.OnBeginPlot
member.summary: Clients of the plot progress dialog would fire this event before beginning to plot using the plot engine. The default implementation resets the plot and sheet status.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PlotProgressDialog.OnEndPlot
member.summary: Clients of the plot progress dialog would fire this event after the end of the plot process using the plot engine. The default implementation closes the plot progress dialog and the associated UI thread object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PlotProgressDialog.OnBeginSheet
member.summary: Clients of the plot progress dialog would fire this event before beginning to plot a sheet using the plot engine. The default implementation resets the sheet status and restores the UI from the previous canceled state (if the previous sheet plot was canceled).

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PlotProgressDialog.OnEndSheet
member.summary: Clients of the plot progress dialog would fire this event after the end of a sheet plot process using the plot engine.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PlotProgressDialog.Destroy
member.summary: Destroys the dialog.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PlotLogger.EndJob

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PreviewEndPlotStatus
member.summary: Status values for PreviewEndPlotInfo object.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PreviewEndPlotStatus.Cancel
member.summary: The preview has terminated abnormally. The user or the host application has requested that the entire plotting operation be terminated and control should be returned to the host application. (For example, if the preview occurred because of a custom AutoCAD command, the command should be terminated and control returned to AutoCAD.).

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PreviewEndPlotStatus.Previous
member.summary: The user has exited the preview state by clicking on the Previous Sheet preview state toolbar button.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PreviewEndPlotStatus.Next
member.summary: The user has exited the preview state by clicking on the Next Sheet preview state toolbar button.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PreviewEndPlotStatus.Plot
member.summary: The preview has terminated normally, and the user has requested a plot operation directly from the preview user interface. Client applications should proceed with a plot using the same PlotInfo object that was used to generate the preview.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.PreviewEndPlotStatus.Normal
member.summary: The preview has terminated normally, and the user has not requested a plot operation directly from the plot preview user interface.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.ProcessPlotState

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.ProcessPlotState.BackgroundPlotting
member.summary: Plot is in progress in a background process; this process is the foreground process.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.ProcessPlotState.ForegroundPlotting
member.summary: Plot is in progress in the current process.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.ProcessPlotState.NotPlotting
member.summary: No plot is in progress.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.MatchingPolicy
member.summary: This enumeration defines the supported media-matching policies on the PlotInfoValidator class.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.MatchingPolicy.MatchEnabledTemporaryCustom
member.summary: Media matching is enabled. If no matching media is found, a custom size is created and saved in a temporary PC3/PMP file, which is deleted when the validated PlotInfo object is destroyed.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.MatchingPolicy.MatchEnabledCustom
member.summary: Media matching is enabled. If no matching media is found, a custom size is created and saved to disk.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.MatchingPolicy.MatchEnabled
member.summary: Media matching is enabled.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.MatchingPolicy.MatchDisabled
member.summary: Media matching is disabled.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults
member.summary: This enumeration defines the return flags from the PlotInfoValidator.IsCustomSizePossible() method.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.DeviceLoadFailed
member.summary: The device specified in the layout, overrides, or device override could not be loaded to determine if it supports custom paper sizes.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.WidthAndHeightMustBePositive
member.summary: Page width and page height must be positive.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.PmpFileReadOnly
member.summary: The PMP file is read-only. Custom sizes are not possible unless a temporary PMP file is created.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.UnknownErrPmpFile
member.summary: There is an unknown error with the PMP file;custom sizes are not possible.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.UnknownErrPC3File
member.summary: There is an unknown error with the PC3 file;custom sizes are not possible.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.Exception
member.summary: An exception has occurred.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.SizeTooBig
member.summary: The page size is too big for the device.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.PC3FileReadOnly
member.summary: The PC3 file is read-only. Custom sizes are not possible unless a temporary PC3 file is created.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.UnknownErrPmpDir
member.summary: There is an unknown error with the PMP directory; custom sizes are not possible.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.PmpDirMissing
member.summary: The PMP directory does not exist; custom sizes are not possible.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.PmpDirReadOnly
member.summary: The PMP directory is read-only; custom sizes are not possible.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.PC3DirReadOnly
member.summary: The PC3 directory is read-only;custom sizes are not possible.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.RotationRequired
member.summary: The size is possible, but a 90-degree rotation is required.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.MustCreatePC3
member.summary: No PC3 file exists for the configuration; one must be created.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.PlottingServices.CustomSizeResults.Possible
member.summary: The custom size is possible.

member.summary: Gets the image type value.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.Image.Load(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream)
member.summary: This method will fail if the stream contains an unsupported image. The image has to be loaded successfully before making any calls to other member functions of the class.
member.param: The stream that contains the image data.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.Image.Load(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This method will fail if the stream contains an unsupported image. The image has to be loaded successfully before making any calls to other member functions of the class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.Image.Load(System.String)
member.summary: This method will fail if the stream contains an unsupported image. The image has to be loaded successfully before making any calls to other member functions of the class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.Image.Save(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream)
member.summary: This method will fail if the Image has not been loaded successfully. Before this method is called, the image must be loaded successfully. GIF images are saved in PNG format.
member.param: The stream into which the image must be written.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.Image.Save(System.String)
member.summary: This method will fail if the Image has not been loaded successfully. Before this method is called, the image must be loaded successfully. GIF images are saved in PNG format. While saving a GIF image, the file extension of filename is not changed even though the saved format is PNG.
member.param: Image file to save with path.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.Image.Draw(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.DrawImageOption,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method is used to render the loaded image. The image must be loaded before it can be rendered.
member.param: Device context on which to render the image.
Dimension of destination rectangle.
Specifies how the image is to be rendered.

If true, then the bitmap images are drawn with a transparent background, and the transparent color is assumed to be the color of the pixel at the 0,0 position; if false, then the bitmap images are drawn as opaque; the argument is ignored for all the other image types.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.ImageList.UpdateImage(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.Image)
member.summary: Checks the image list for the image with the same size as the passed image and, if it finds it, replaces it with the passed image. If there is no image with the same size as the passed image, then the passed image is added to the image list. If the image list has multiple images of the same size, the first image with the size is updated.
member.param: An Image object that needs to replace the image of the same size.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the updated or added image if successful, and returns -1 if it fails.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.ImageList.Delete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the image at the specified index.
member.param: Zero-based index of the image; the index should be in the range of zero to one less than the number of images.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.ImageList.DeleteAllImages
member.summary: Deletes all of the images in the image list.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.ImageList.GetImageIndex(System.Drawing.Size,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If exactMatch is false, and if the image with the same size is not found, then the index of the image with the next highest size is returned. If the next highest size is not available, then the index of the image with the next lowest size is returned.
member.param: Size of the image; only width is used and height is ignored.
If true, then the index of the image matching the exact size is returned; if false, then the index of the image matching the next highest size is returned.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the new image if successful.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.ToolPaletteManager
member.summary: The tool manager, contains and manages stock tool and workspace catalogs. Stock tools are stored in stock tool files (as either one stock tool per file or multiple stock tools in a catalog file). Stock tool files are stored in the stock tool catalog directory.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.ToolPaletteManager.Schemes
member.summary: Gets schemes currently in the manager.

member.summary: Gets or sets the shape catalog file name and path.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.CustomToolBase
member.summary: This abstract class defines a general custom tool that can be used to implement any type of tool supported by tool palettes. It aggregates the various tool interfaces and provides extensive boilerplate implementations that simplify the creation of custom tools.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcadTool
member.summary: This interface provides the primary communication channel between the tool palette framework and tools implemented by tool writers. It is defined by the framework, which uses tools through this interface.

member.summary: The framework calls this method immediately after creating the COM object for IAcadTool, passing in an interface to the display properties of the tool. The display properties of the tool are maintained by the framework. The tool can cache this interface and use it to get/set the tool display properties.
member.param: The IAcadToolProperties object for the tool.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcadTool.Execute(System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Executes the tool. The tool implementation code can do anything in this method: start a command, create an object, set object state, and so on. This method is modal. When the method returns, the framework assumes that execution is finished.
member.param: Value provides context information.
Windows handle.
Point where the tool was dropped.
Value contains the state of the modifier keys.

member.summary: If the framework has to handle tool editing by using the property inspector control in a modal dialog, it calls this method to get the COM interfaces the property inspector needs to edit the tool.
member.param: Variant array.
Variant of arrays.

member.summary: This method is called by the framework before displaying the dialog to edit the tool properties.

member.summary: Sets an image or deletes an image. A tool can have multiple size images associated with it. This method replaces the image of the specified size if an image of same size exists. If an image of the same size does not exist, it adds the image to the list.

Height of the image; this parameter is ignored.

Resource identifier of the image if the image resides in a resource DLL.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcadStockTool
member.summary: This interface is defined by the framework. Tool writers implement this interface in a COM object. Each stock tool is implemented in a separate COM object. The framework creates the COM object using information stored in the stock tool file, gets the IAcadStockTool interface, and then calls the interface object's CreateTool() method to create the tools.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcadStockTool.CreateTool
member.summary: Create the COM object which implements the IAcadTool interface if the IAcadStockTool interface is implemented in a separate COM object.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcadToolContextMenu
member.summary: The stock tool implements this interface if it wants to customize the context menu displayed in the palette background. This interface is queried from the IAcadStockTool interface.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcadToolContextMenu.Customize(System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Guid@)
member.summary: This method gives the stock tool an opportunity to customize the context menu. It is called by the framework when the context menu is about to be displayed in the tool palette background, palette tabs, palette set caption, or palette set option button. At that time, this method is called on all registered stock tools.
member.param: Enum specifies the context in which the context menu is invoked.
Context menu handle.
Minimum value that the tool can specify for a menu item identifier.
Maximum value that the handler can specify for a menu item identifier.
If the context is ContextMenuPaletteSetTab, this contains the ID of the palette that corresponds to the tab (active or inactive); for all other contexts, this contains the ID of the active palette .
member.returns: Value indicates the context menu's display state.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcadToolContextMenu.GetMenuHelp(System.UInt32)
member.summary: The framework calls this method to get the fly-by, one-line help text to be displayed for the command added to a context menu by the tool's GetContextMenu() method. This help is not used currently but may be used in future.
member.param: ID of the command for which help text is required.
member.returns: Help text for the command.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcadToolContextMenu.InvokeMenuCommand(System.UInt32,System.Guid@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The framework calls this method when the user chooses a command that this stock tool has added to the context menu. A stock tool adds context menu commands in its Customize() method.
member.param: Command identifier.
ID of the palette.
Window handle.
member.returns: Flag that can be set to force an update of the palette.

member.summary: Returns an alternate or localized name for the property specified by dispatchId.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IOPMPropertyExtension.Editable(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method allows properties which are not read-only in the type information to be displayed as read-only (in other words, grayed out) in the Properties window. This allows the developer to disable certain properties at run-time. This is useful if certain properties should not be editable or don't make sense based on the value of another property.
member.param: Dispatch identifier of the property whose editable flag is being overridden.
Value contains the editable flag.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IOPMPropertyExtension.ShowProperty(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method allows properties to be removed entirely from the property list for a particular object. This allows the developer to remove certain properties at run-time. This is useful if certain properties should not be visible or don't make sense based on the value of another property.
member.param: Dispatch identifier of the property whose showable flag is being overridden.
Value contains the showable flag.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcPiCategorizeProperties
member.summary: Objects and commands implement this interface to categorize static and dynamic properties for display in the Property Inspector. This extends the existing ICategorizeProperties interface.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IAcPiCategorizeProperties.MapPropertyToCategory(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method is invoked for every property of an active object or command. The Property Inspector uses it to associate every static and dynamic property with a parent category. If no parent category is specified, the corresponding property is grouped under the General category.
member.param: DISPID of the property.
Output category ID that categorizes the property identified by the dispatchId parameter.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.IPerPropertyBrowsing
member.summary: It is typically used by property inspectors, such as the Properties palette, to display property pages for objects that provide them. IPerPropertyBrowsing serves two basic functions. The first is to associate a property page or other dialog box with a particular property via an ellipsis button on the Properties palette dialog box. The second is to support custom property drop-down lists in the Properties palette control.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.LoadFlags.LoadImages
member.summary: Load images while loading the item. If this option is not set, the images are loaded on demand. Use this option only if it is necessary to load images "up front," because statically loaded images unnecessarily occupy memory while not in use.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.LoadFlags.LoadLinks
member.summary: Load linked items also.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.SaveFlags
member.summary: Enumerates options for saving catalog item data.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.SaveFlags.SaveImages
member.summary: Saves all images, including those that have not changed. If this option is not specified, saves only those images that have been modified and those whose destination files differ from their source files. Use this option only to force saving of all the images.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.SaveFlags.SaveLinksAsEmbedded
member.summary: Embed all linked items in this item and save them to the specified archive. Linked items become embedded items. Linked items are saved if either SaveFlags.SaveLinksAsLinks or SaveFlags.SaveLinksAsEmbedded is specified.

member.name: F:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Windows.ToolPalette.SaveFlags.SaveLinksAsLinks
member.summary: Save linked items into their own linked files, thus preserving the links. Linked items are saved if either SaveFlags.SaveLinksAsLinks or SaveFlags.SaveLinksAsEmbedded is specified.
